title: Rory Duncan
text:
Rory Duncan (born 26 July 1977) is a former <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> coach and former player.
He started his career at the , representing them in the <a href="Vodacom%20Cup">Vodacom Cup</a> in <a href="1999%20Vodacom%20Cup">1999</a> and <a href="2001%20Vodacom%20Cup">2001</a>. He then the joined in 2002, where he played for four seasons before moving to the in 2006. Between 2008 and 2010, he had a spell at Japanese <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a> club <a href="Yamaha%20J%C3%BAbilo">Yamaha Júbilo</a> before returning to the for the <a href="2010%20Currie%20Cup%20First%20Division">2010 Currie Cup</a> season. He announced his retirement at the end of 2011.
After two seasons as head coach at <a href="Grey%20High%20School">Grey High School</a>, Duncan joined the in November 2013 to become the coach of their <a href="Vodacom%20Cup">Vodacom Cup</a> and Under-21 sides. He is currently their Director of Rugby and <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> head coach.
